snippet: The release of the prisoners, including a Taliban commander who was arrested in 2008, comes as both the Afghan government and the Taliban have been demanding that such militants be let go.
abstract: Pakistan releases seven Taliban prisoners, as requested by Afghan Pres Hamid Karzai, to facilitate peace process; Afghan officials confirm exchange of 11 Taliban prisoners for female member of Afghan Parliament, who had been kidnapped by insurgents; no guarantees are given that former prisoners will not rejoin insurgency.

byline.original: By ROD NORDLAND and SHARIFULLAH SAHAK
byline.contributor: Salman Masood contributed reporting from Islamabad, Pakistan, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: The release of the prisoners, including a Taliban commander who was arrested in 2008, comes as both the Afghan government and the Taliban have been demanding that such militants be let go.

headline.main: Afghanistan and Pakistan Release Taliban Militants
headline.print_headline: Afghanistan and Pakistan Release Taliban Militants
